  42. ‌type primitive =

  44.   | Pbytes_of_string

  54.   | Psetfield_computed of immediate_or_pointer * initialization_or_assignment

  56.   | Psetfloatfield of int * initialization_or_assignment
  57.   | Pduprecord of Types.record_representation * int

  60.   | Pperform
  61.   | Presume
  62.   | Preperform

  64.   | Pccall of Primitive.description

  67.   (* Boolean operations *)

  83.   (* String operations *)
  84.   | Pstringlength | Pstringrefu  | Pstringrefs
  85.   | Pbyteslength | Pbytesrefu | Pbytessetu | Pbytesrefs | Pbytessets

  89.   | Parraylength of array_kind
  90.   | Parrayrefu of array_kind

  93.   | Parraysets of array_kind
  94.   (* Test if the argument is a block or an immediate integer *)
  95.   | Pisint
  96.   (* Test if the (integer) argument is outside an interval *)
  97.   | Pisout
  98.   (* Operations on boxed integers (Nativeint.t, Int32.t, Int64.t) *)
  99.   | Pbintofint of boxed_integer

  192. ‌let equal_boxed_integer = Primitive.equal_boxed_integer

  194. ‌let equal_primitive =
  195.   (* Should be implemented like [equal_value_kind] of [equal_boxed_integer],
  196.      i.e. by matching over the various constructors but the type has more
  197.      than 100 constructors... *)
  198.   (=)

  200. ‌let equal_value_kind x y =
  201.   match x, y with
  202.   | Pgenval, Pgenval -> true
  203.   | Pfloatval, Pfloatval -> true
  204.   | Pboxedintval bi1, Pboxedintval bi2 -> equal_boxed_integer bi1 bi2
  205.   | Pintval, Pintval -> true
  206.   | (Pgenval | Pfloatval | Pboxedintval _ | Pintval), _ -> false


  209. ‌type structured_constant =
  210.     Const_base of constant
  211.   | Const_block of int * structured_constant list
  212.   | Const_float_array of string list
  213.   | Const_immstring of string

  215. ‌type tailcall_attribute =
  216.   | Tailcall_expectation of bool
  217.     (* [@tailcall] and [@tailcall true] have [true],
  218.        [@tailcall false] has [false] *)
  219.   | Default_tailcall (* no [@tailcall] attribute *)

  221. ‌type inline_attribute =
  222.   | Always_inline (* [@inline] or [@inline always] *)
  223.   | Never_inline (* [@inline never] *)
  224.   | Hint_inline (* [@inlined hint] attribute *)
  225.   | Unroll of int (* [@unroll x] *)
  226.   | Default_inline (* no [@inline] attribute *)

  228. ‌let equal_inline_attribute x y =
  229.   match x, y with
  230.   | Always_inline, Always_inline
  231.   | Never_inline, Never_inline
  232.   | Hint_inline, Hint_inline
  233.   | Default_inline, Default_inline
  234.     ->
  235.     true
  236.   | Unroll u, Unroll v ->
  237.     u = v
  238.   | (Always_inline | Never_inline
  239.     | Hint_inline | Unroll _ | Default_inline), _ ->
  240.     false

  242. ‌type specialise_attribute =
  243.   | Always_specialise (* [@specialise] or [@specialise always] *)
  244.   | Never_specialise (* [@specialise never] *)
  245.   | Default_specialise (* no [@specialise] attribute *)

  247. ‌let equal_specialise_attribute x y =
  248.   match x, y with
  249.   | Always_specialise, Always_specialise
  250.   | Never_specialise, Never_specialise
  251.   | Default_specialise, Default_specialise ->
  252.     true
  253.   | (Always_specialise | Never_specialise | Default_specialise), _ ->
  254.     false

  256. ‌type local_attribute =
  257.   | Always_local (* [@local] or [@local always] *)
  258.   | Never_local (* [@local never] *)
  259.   | Default_local (* [@local maybe] or no [@local] attribute *)

  261. ‌type poll_attribute =
  262.   | Error_poll (* [@poll error] *)
  263.   | Default_poll (* no [@poll] attribute *)

  265. ‌type function_kind = Curried | Tupled

  267. ‌type let_kind = Strict | Alias | StrictOpt

  269. ‌type meth_kind = Self | Public | Cached

  271. ‌let equal_meth_kind x y =
  272.   match x, y with
  273.   | Self, Self -> true
  274.   | Public, Public -> true
  275.   | Cached, Cached -> true
  276.   | (Self | Public | Cached), _ -> false

  278. ‌type shared_code = (int * int) list

  280. ‌type function_attribute = {
  281.   inline : inline_attribute;
  282.   specialise : specialise_attribute;
  283.   local: local_attribute;
  284.   poll: poll_attribute;
  285.   is_a_functor: bool;
  286.   stub: bool;
  287.   tmc_candidate: bool;
  288. }

  290. ‌type scoped_location = Debuginfo.Scoped_location.t

  292. ‌type lambda =
  293.     Lvar of Ident.t
  294.   | Lmutvar of Ident.t
  295.   | Lconst of structured_constant
  296.   | Lapply of lambda_apply
  297.   | Lfunction of lfunction
  298.   | Llet of let_kind * value_kind * Ident.t * lambda * lambda
  299.   | Lmutlet of value_kind * Ident.t * lambda * lambda
  300.   | Lletrec of (Ident.t * lambda) list * lambda
  301.   | Lprim of primitive * lambda list * scoped_location
  302.   | Lswitch of lambda * lambda_switch * scoped_location
  303.   | Lstringswitch of
  304.       lambda * (string * lambda) list * lambda option * scoped_location
  305.   | Lstaticraise of int * lambda list
  306.   | Lstaticcatch of lambda * (int * (Ident.t * value_kind) list) * lambda
  307.   | Ltrywith of lambda * Ident.t * lambda
  308.   | Lifthenelse of lambda * lambda * lambda
  309.   | Lsequence of lambda * lambda
  310.   | Lwhile of lambda * lambda
  311.   | Lfor of Ident.t * lambda * lambda * direction_flag * lambda
  312.   | Lassign of Ident.t * lambda
  313.   | Lsend of meth_kind * lambda * lambda * lambda list * scoped_location
  314.   | Levent of lambda * lambda_event
  315.   | Lifused of Ident.t * lambda

  317. ‌and lfunction =
  318.   { kind: function_kind;
  319.     params: (Ident.t * value_kind) list;
  320.     return: value_kind;
  321.     body: lambda;
  322.     attr: function_attribute; (* specified with [@inline] attribute *)
  323.     loc: scoped_location; }

  325. ‌and lambda_apply =
  326.   { ap_func : lambda;
  327.     ap_args : lambda list;
  328.     ap_loc : scoped_location;
  329.     ap_tailcall : tailcall_attribute;
  330.     ap_inlined : inline_attribute;
  331.     ap_specialised : specialise_attribute; }

  333. ‌and lambda_switch =
  334.   { sw_numconsts: int;
  335.     sw_consts: (int * lambda) list;
  336.     sw_numblocks: int;
  337.     sw_blocks: (int * lambda) list;
  338.     sw_failaction : lambda option}

  340. ‌and lambda_event =
  341.   { lev_loc: scoped_location;
  342.     lev_kind: lambda_event_kind;
  343.     lev_repr: int ref option;
  344.     lev_env: Env.t }

  346. ‌and lambda_event_kind =
  347.     Lev_before
  348.   | Lev_after of Types.type_expr
  349.   | Lev_function
  350.   | Lev_pseudo

  352. ‌type program =
  353.   { module_ident : Ident.t;
  354.     main_module_block_size : int;
  355.     required_globals : Ident.Set.t;
  356.     code : lambda }

  358. ‌let const_int n = Const_base (Const_int n)

  360. ‌let const_unit = const_int 0

  362. ‌let max_arity () =
  363.   if !Clflags.native_code then 126 else max_int
  364.   (* 126 = 127 (the maximal number of parameters supported in C--)
  365.            - 1 (the hidden parameter containing the environment) *)

  367. ‌let lfunction ~kind ~params ~return ~body ~attr ~loc =
  368.   assert (List.length params <= max_arity ());
  369.   Lfunction { kind; params; return; body; attr; loc }

  371. let lambda_unit = Lconst const_unit

  373. let default_function_attribute = {
  374.   inline = Default_inline;
  375.   specialise = Default_specialise;
  376.   local = Default_local;
  377.   poll = Default_poll;
  378.   is_a_functor = false;
  379.   stub = false;
  380.   tmc_candidate = false;
  381. }

  383. let default_stub_attribute =
  384.   { default_function_attribute with stub = true }

  386. (* Build sharing keys *)
  387. (*
  388.    Those keys are later compared with Stdlib.compare.
  389.    For that reason, they should not include cycles.
  390. *)

  392. let max_raw = 32

  394. let make_key e =
  395.   let exception Not_simple in
  396.   let count = ref 0   (* Used for controlling size *)
  397.   and make_key = Ident.make_key_generator () in
  398.   (* make_key is used for normalizing let-bound variables *)
  399.   let rec tr_rec env e =
  400.     incr count ;
  401.     if !count > max_raw then raise Not_simple ; (* Too big ! *)
  402.     match e with
  403.     | Lvar id
  404.     | Lmutvar id ->
  405.       begin
  406.         try Ident.find_same id env
  407.         with Not_found -> e
  408.       end
  409.     | Lconst  (Const_base (Const_string _)) ->
  410.         (* Mutable constants are not shared *)
  411.         raise Not_simple
  412.     | Lconst _ -> e
  413.     | Lapply ap ->
  414.         Lapply {ap with ap_func = tr_rec env ap.ap_func;
  415.                         ap_args = tr_recs env ap.ap_args;
  416.                         ap_loc = Loc_unknown}
  417.     | Llet (Alias,_k,x,ex,e) -> (* Ignore aliases -> substitute *)
  418.         let ex = tr_rec env ex in
  419.         tr_rec (Ident.add x ex env) e
  420.     | Llet ((Strict | StrictOpt),_k,x,ex,Lvar v) when Ident.same v x ->
  421.         tr_rec env ex
  422.     | Llet (str,k,x,ex,e) ->
  423.      (* Because of side effects, keep other lets with normalized names *)
  424.         let ex = tr_rec env ex in
  425.         let y = make_key x in
  426.         Llet (str,k,y,ex,tr_rec (Ident.add x (Lvar y) env) e)
  427.     | Lmutlet (k,x,ex,e) ->
  428.         let ex = tr_rec env ex in
  429.         let y = make_key x in
  430.         Lmutlet (k,y,ex,tr_rec (Ident.add x (Lmutvar y) env) e)
  431.     | Lprim (p,es,_) ->
  432.         Lprim (p,tr_recs env es, Loc_unknown)
  433.     | Lswitch (e,sw,loc) ->
  434.         Lswitch (tr_rec env e,tr_sw env sw,loc)
  435.     | Lstringswitch (e,sw,d,_) ->
  436.         Lstringswitch
  437.           (tr_rec env e,
  438.            List.map (fun (s,e) -> s,tr_rec env e) sw,
  439.            tr_opt env d,
  440.           Loc_unknown)
  441.     | Lstaticraise (i,es) ->
  442.         Lstaticraise (i,tr_recs env es)
  443.     | Lstaticcatch (e1,xs,e2) ->
  444.         Lstaticcatch (tr_rec env e1,xs,tr_rec env e2)
  445.     | Ltrywith (e1,x,e2) ->
  446.         Ltrywith (tr_rec env e1,x,tr_rec env e2)
  447.     | Lifthenelse (cond,ifso,ifnot) ->
  448.         Lifthenelse (tr_rec env cond,tr_rec env ifso,tr_rec env ifnot)
  449.     | Lsequence (e1,e2) ->
  450.         Lsequence (tr_rec env e1,tr_rec env e2)
  451.     | Lassign (x,e) ->
  452.         Lassign (x,tr_rec env e)
  453.     | Lsend (m,e1,e2,es,_loc) ->
  454.         Lsend (m,tr_rec env e1,tr_rec env e2,tr_recs env es,Loc_unknown)
  455.     | Lifused (id,e) -> Lifused (id,tr_rec env e)
  456.     | Lletrec _|Lfunction _
  457.     | Lfor _ | Lwhile _
  458. (* Beware: (PR#6412) the event argument to Levent
  459.    may include cyclic structure of type Type.typexpr *)
  460.     | Levent _  ->
  461.         raise Not_simple

  463.   and tr_recs env es = List.map (tr_rec env) es

  465.   and tr_sw env sw =
  466.     { sw with
  467.       sw_consts = List.map (fun (i,e) -> i,tr_rec env e) sw.sw_consts ;
  468.       sw_blocks = List.map (fun (i,e) -> i,tr_rec env e) sw.sw_blocks ;
  469.       sw_failaction = tr_opt env sw.sw_failaction ; }

  471.   and tr_opt env = function
  472.     | None -> None
  473.     | Some e -> Some (tr_rec env e) in

  475.   try
  476.     Some (tr_rec Ident.empty e)
  477.   with Not_simple -> None

  479. (***************)

  481. let name_lambda strict arg fn =
  482.   match arg with
  483.     Lvar id -> fn id
  484.   | _ ->
  485.       let id = Ident.create_local "let" in
  486.       Llet(strict, Pgenval, id, arg, fn id)

  488. let name_lambda_list args fn =
  489.   let rec name_list names = function
  490.     [] -> fn (List.rev names)
  491.   | (Lvar _ as arg) :: rem ->
  492.       name_list (arg :: names) rem
  493.   | arg :: rem ->
  494. ‌      let id = Ident.create_local "let" in
  495.       Llet(Strict, Pgenval, id, arg, name_list (Lvar id :: names) rem) in
  496.   name_list [] args


  499. ‌let iter_opt f = function
  500.   | None -> ()
  501.   | Some e -> f e

  503. ‌let shallow_iter ~tail ~non_tail:f = function
  504.     Lvar _
  505.   | Lmutvar _
  506.   | Lconst _ -> ()
  507.   | Lapply{ap_func = fn; ap_args = args} ->
  508.       f fn; List.iter f args
  509.   | Lfunction{body} ->
  510.       f body
  511.   | Llet(_, _k, _id, arg, body)
  512.   | Lmutlet(_k, _id, arg, body) ->
  513.       f arg; tail body
  514.   | Lletrec(decl, body) ->
  515.       tail body;
  516.       List.iter (fun (_id, exp) -> f exp) decl
  517.   | Lprim (Psequand, [l1; l2], _)
  518.   | Lprim (Psequor, [l1; l2], _) ->
  519.       f l1;
  520.       tail l2
  521.   | Lprim(_p, args, _loc) ->
  522.       List.iter f args
  523.   | Lswitch(arg, sw,_) ->
  524.       f arg;
  525.       List.iter (fun (_key, case) -> tail case) sw.sw_consts;
  526.       List.iter (fun (_key, case) -> tail case) sw.sw_blocks;
  527.       iter_opt tail sw.sw_failaction
  528.   | Lstringswitch (arg,cases,default,_) ->
  529.       f arg ;
  530.       List.iter (fun (_,act) -> tail act) cases ;
  531.       iter_opt tail default
  532.   | Lstaticraise (_,args) ->
  533.       List.iter f args
  534.   | Lstaticcatch(e1, _, e2) ->
  535.       tail e1; tail e2
  536.   | Ltrywith(e1, _, e2) ->
  537.       f e1; tail e2
  538.   | Lifthenelse(e1, e2, e3) ->
  539.       f e1; tail e2; tail e3
  540.   | Lsequence(e1, e2) ->
  541.       f e1; tail e2
  542.   | Lwhile(e1, e2) ->
  543.       f e1; f e2
  544.   | Lfor(_v, e1, e2, _dir, e3) ->
  545.       f e1; f e2; f e3
  546.   | Lassign(_, e) ->
  547.       f e
  548.   | Lsend (_k, met, obj, args, _) ->
  549.       List.iter f (met::obj::args)
  550.   | Levent (e, _evt) ->
  551.       tail e
  552.   | Lifused (_v, e) ->
  553.       tail e

  555. ‌let iter_head_constructor f l =
  556.   shallow_iter ~tail:f ~non_tail:f l

  558. ‌let rec free_variables = function
  559.   | Lvar id
  560.   | Lmutvar id -> Ident.Set.singleton id
  561.   | Lconst _ -> Ident.Set.empty
  562.   | Lapply{ap_func = fn; ap_args = args} ->
  563.       free_variables_list (free_variables fn) args
  564.   | Lfunction{body; params} ->
  565.       Ident.Set.diff (free_variables body)
  566.         (Ident.Set.of_list (List.map fst params))
  567.   | Llet(_, _k, id, arg, body)
  568.   | Lmutlet(_k, id, arg, body) ->
  569.       Ident.Set.union
  570.         (free_variables arg)
  571.         (Ident.Set.remove id (free_variables body))
  572.   | Lletrec(decl, body) ->
  573.       let set = free_variables_list (free_variables body) (List.map snd decl) in
  574.       Ident.Set.diff set (Ident.Set.of_list (List.map fst decl))
  575.   | Lprim(_p, args, _loc) ->
  576.       free_variables_list Ident.Set.empty args
  577.   | Lswitch(arg, sw,_) ->
  578.       let set =
  579.         free_variables_list
  580.           (free_variables_list (free_variables arg)
  581.              (List.map snd sw.sw_consts))
  582.           (List.map snd sw.sw_blocks)
  583.       in
  584.       begin match sw.sw_failaction with
  585.       | None -> set
  586.       | Some failaction -> Ident.Set.union set (free_variables failaction)
  587.       end
  588.   | Lstringswitch (arg,cases,default,_) ->
  589.       let set =
  590.         free_variables_list (free_variables arg)
  591.           (List.map snd cases)
  592.       in
  593.       begin match default with
  594.       | None -> set
  595.       | Some default -> Ident.Set.union set (free_variables default)
  596.       end
  597.   | Lstaticraise (_,args) ->
  598.       free_variables_list Ident.Set.empty args
  599.   | Lstaticcatch(body, (_, params), handler) ->
  600.       Ident.Set.union
  601.         (Ident.Set.diff
  602.            (free_variables handler)
  603.            (Ident.Set.of_list (List.map fst params)))
  604.         (free_variables body)
  605.   | Ltrywith(body, param, handler) ->
  606.       Ident.Set.union
  607.         (Ident.Set.remove
  608.            param
  609.            (free_variables handler))
  610.         (free_variables body)
  611.   | Lifthenelse(e1, e2, e3) ->
  612.       Ident.Set.union
  613.         (Ident.Set.union (free_variables e1) (free_variables e2))
  614.         (free_variables e3)
  615.   | Lsequence(e1, e2) ->
  616.       Ident.Set.union (free_variables e1) (free_variables e2)
  617.   | Lwhile(e1, e2) ->
  618.       Ident.Set.union (free_variables e1) (free_variables e2)
  619.   | Lfor(v, lo, hi, _dir, body) ->
  620.       let set = Ident.Set.union (free_variables lo) (free_variables hi) in
  621.       Ident.Set.union set (Ident.Set.remove v (free_variables body))
  622.   | Lassign(id, e) ->
  623.       Ident.Set.add id (free_variables e)
  624.   | Lsend (_k, met, obj, args, _) ->
  625.       free_variables_list
  626.         (Ident.Set.union (free_variables met) (free_variables obj))
  627.         args
  628.   | Levent (lam, _evt) ->
  629.       free_variables lam
  630.   | Lifused (_v, e) ->
  631.       (* Shouldn't v be considered a free variable ? *)
  632.       free_variables e

  634. and free_variables_list set exprs =
  635.   List.fold_left (fun set expr -> Ident.Set.union (free_variables expr) set)
  636.     set exprs

  638. (* Check if an action has a "when" guard *)
  639. let raise_count = ref 0

  641. let next_raise_count () =
  642.   incr raise_count ;
  643.   !raise_count

  645. (* Anticipated staticraise, for guards *)
  646. let staticfail = Lstaticraise (0,[])

  648. let rec is_guarded = function
  649.   | Lifthenelse(_cond, _body, Lstaticraise (0,[])) -> true
  650.   | Llet(_str, _k, _id, _lam, body) -> is_guarded body
  651.   | Levent(lam, _ev) -> is_guarded lam
  652.   | _ -> false

  654. ‌let rec patch_guarded patch = function
  655.   | Lifthenelse (cond, body, Lstaticraise (0,[])) ->
  656.       Lifthenelse (cond, body, patch)
  657.   | Llet(str, k, id, lam, body) ->
  658.       Llet (str, k, id, lam, patch_guarded patch body)
  659.   | Levent(lam, ev) ->
  660.       Levent (patch_guarded patch lam, ev)
  661.   | _ -> fatal_error "Lambda.patch_guarded"

  663. (* Translate an access path *)

  665. ‌let rec transl_address loc = function
  666.   | Env.Aident id ->
  667.       if Ident.global id
  668.       then Lprim(Pgetglobal id, [], loc)
  669.       else Lvar id
  670.   | Env.Adot(addr, pos) ->
  671.       Lprim(Pfield(pos, Pointer, Immutable),
  672.                    [transl_address loc addr], loc)

  674. ‌let transl_path find loc env path =
  675.   match find path env with
  676.   | exception Not_found ->
  677.       fatal_error ("Cannot find address for: " ^ (Path.name path))
  678.   | addr -> transl_address loc addr

  680. (* Translation of identifiers *)

  682. ‌let transl_module_path loc env path =
  683.   transl_path Env.find_module_address loc env path

  685. ‌let transl_value_path loc env path =
  686.   transl_path Env.find_value_address loc env path

  688. ‌let transl_extension_path loc env path =
  689.   transl_path Env.find_constructor_address loc env path

  691. ‌let transl_class_path loc env path =
  692.   transl_path Env.find_class_address loc env path

  694. ‌let transl_prim mod_name name =
  695.   let pers = Ident.create_persistent mod_name in
  696.   let env = Env.add_persistent_structure pers Env.empty in
  697.   let lid = Longident.Ldot (Longident.Lident mod_name, name) in
  698.   match Env.find_value_by_name lid env with
  699.   | path, _ -> transl_value_path Loc_unknown env path
  700.   | exception Not_found ->
  701.       fatal_error ("Primitive " ^ name ^ " not found.")

  703. (* Compile a sequence of expressions *)

  705. ‌let rec make_sequence fn = function
  706.     [] -> lambda_unit
  707.   | [x] -> fn x
  708.   | x::rem ->
  709.       let lam = fn x in Lsequence(lam, make_sequence fn rem)

  711. (* Apply a substitution to a lambda-term.
  712.    Assumes that the image of the substitution is out of reach
  713.    of the bound variables of the lambda-term (no capture). *)

  715. ‌let subst update_env ?(freshen_bound_variables = false) s input_lam =
  716.   (* [s] contains a partial substitution for the free variables of the
  717.      input term [input_lam].

  719.      During our traversal of the term we maintain a second environment
  720.      [l] with all the bound variables of [input_lam] in the current
  721.      scope, mapped to either themselves or freshened versions of
  722.      themselves when [freshen_bound_variables] is set. *)
  723.   let bind id l =
  724.     let id' = if not freshen_bound_variables then id else Ident.rename id in
  725.     id', Ident.Map.add id id' l
  726.   in
  727. ‌  let bind_many ids l =
  728.     List.fold_right (fun (id, rhs) (ids', l) ->
  729.         let id', l = bind id l in
  730.         ((id', rhs) :: ids' , l)
  731.       ) ids ([], l)
  732.   in
  733. ‌  let rec subst s l lam =
  734.     match lam with
  735.     | Lvar id as lam ->
  736.         begin match Ident.Map.find id l with
  737.           | id' -> Lvar id'
  738.           | exception Not_found ->
  739.              (* note: as this point we know [id] is not a bound
  740.                 variable of the input term, otherwise it would belong
  741.                 to [l]; it is a free variable of the input term. *)
  742.              begin try Ident.Map.find id s with Not_found -> lam end
  743.         end
  744.     | Lmutvar id as lam ->
  745.        begin match Ident.Map.find id l with
  746.           | id' -> Lmutvar id'
  747.           | exception Not_found ->
  748.              (* Note: a mutable [id] should not appear in [s].
  749.                 Keeping the behavior of Lvar case for now. *)
  750.              begin try Ident.Map.find id s with Not_found -> lam end
  751.         end
  752.     | Lconst _ as l -> l
  753.     | Lapply ap ->
  754.         Lapply{ap with ap_func = subst s l ap.ap_func;
  755.                       ap_args = subst_list s l ap.ap_args}
  756.     | Lfunction lf ->
  757.         let params, l' = bind_many lf.params l in
  758.         Lfunction {lf with params; body = subst s l' lf.body}
  759.     | Llet(str, k, id, arg, body) ->
  760.         let id, l' = bind id l in
  761.         Llet(str, k, id, subst s l arg, subst s l' body)
  762.     | Lmutlet(k, id, arg, body) ->
  763.         let id, l' = bind id l in
  764.         Lmutlet(k, id, subst s l arg, subst s l' body)
  765.     | Lletrec(decl, body) ->
  766.         let decl, l' = bind_many decl l in
  767.         Lletrec(List.map (subst_decl s l') decl, subst s l' body)
  768.     | Lprim(p, args, loc) -> Lprim(p, subst_list s l args, loc)
  769.     | Lswitch(arg, sw, loc) ->
  770.         Lswitch(subst s l arg,
  771.                 {sw with sw_consts = List.map (subst_case s l) sw.sw_consts;
  772.                         sw_blocks = List.map (subst_case s l) sw.sw_blocks;
  773.                         sw_failaction = subst_opt s l sw.sw_failaction; },
  774.                 loc)
  775.     | Lstringswitch (arg,cases,default,loc) ->
  776.         Lstringswitch
  777.           (subst s l arg,
  778.            List.map (subst_strcase s l) cases,
  779.            subst_opt s l default,
  780.            loc)
  781.     | Lstaticraise (i,args) ->  Lstaticraise (i, subst_list s l args)
  782.     | Lstaticcatch(body, (id, params), handler) ->
  783.         let params, l' = bind_many params l in
  784.         Lstaticcatch(subst s l body, (id, params),
  785.                      subst s l' handler)
  786.     | Ltrywith(body, exn, handler) ->
  787.         let exn, l' = bind exn l in
  788.         Ltrywith(subst s l body, exn, subst s l' handler)
  789.     | Lifthenelse(e1, e2, e3) ->
  790.         Lifthenelse(subst s l e1, subst s l e2, subst s l e3)
  791.     | Lsequence(e1, e2) -> Lsequence(subst s l e1, subst s l e2)
  792.     | Lwhile(e1, e2) -> Lwhile(subst s l e1, subst s l e2)
  793.     | Lfor(v, lo, hi, dir, body) ->
  794.         let v, l' = bind v l in
  795.         Lfor(v, subst s l lo, subst s l hi, dir, subst s l' body)
  796.     | Lassign(id, e) ->
  797.         assert (not (Ident.Map.mem id s));
  798.         let id = try Ident.Map.find id l with Not_found -> id in
  799.         Lassign(id, subst s l e)
  800.     | Lsend (k, met, obj, args, loc) ->
  801.         Lsend (k, subst s l met, subst s l obj, subst_list s l args, loc)
  802.     | Levent (lam, evt) ->
  803.         let old_env = evt.lev_env in
  804.         let env_updates =
  805.           let find_in_old id = Env.find_value (Path.Pident id) old_env in
  806.           let rebind id id' new_env =
  807.             match find_in_old id with
  808.             | exception Not_found -> new_env
  809.             | vd -> Env.add_value id' vd new_env
  810.           in
  811.           let update_free id new_env =
  812.             match find_in_old id with
  813.             | exception Not_found -> new_env
  814.             | vd -> update_env id vd new_env
  815.           in
  816.           Ident.Map.merge (fun id bound free ->
  817.             match bound, free with
  818.             | Some id', _ ->
  819.                 if Ident.equal id id' then None else Some (rebind id id')
  820.             | None, Some _ -> Some (update_free id)
  821.             | None, None -> None
  822.           ) l s
  823.         in
  824.         let new_env =
  825.           Ident.Map.fold (fun _id update env -> update env) env_updates old_env
  826.         in
  827.         Levent (subst s l lam, { evt with lev_env = new_env })
  828.     | Lifused (id, e) ->
  829.         let id = try Ident.Map.find id l with Not_found -> id in
  830.         Lifused (id, subst s l e)
  831.   and subst_list s l li = List.map (subst s l) li
  832.   and subst_decl s l (id, exp) = (id, subst s l exp)
  833.   and subst_case s l (key, case) = (key, subst s l case)
  834.   and subst_strcase s l (key, case) = (key, subst s l case)
  835.   and subst_opt s l = function
  836.     | None -> None
  837.     | Some e -> Some (subst s l e)
  838.   in
  839.   subst s Ident.Map.empty input_lam

  841. ‌let rename idmap lam =
  842.   let update_env oldid vd env =
  843.     let newid = Ident.Map.find oldid idmap in
  844.     Env.add_value newid vd env
  845.   in
  846.   let s = Ident.Map.map (fun new_id -> Lvar new_id) idmap in
  847.   subst update_env s lam

  849. ‌let duplicate lam =
  850.   subst
  851.     (fun _ _ env -> env)
  852.     ~freshen_bound_variables:true
  853.     Ident.Map.empty
  854.     lam

  856. let shallow_map f = function
  857.   | Lvar _
  858.   | Lmutvar _
  859.   | Lconst _ as lam -> lam
  860.   | Lapply { ap_func; ap_args; ap_loc; ap_tailcall;
  861.              ap_inlined; ap_specialised } ->
  862.       Lapply {
  863.         ap_func = f ap_func;
  864.         ap_args = List.map f ap_args;
  865.         ap_loc;
  866.         ap_tailcall;
  867.         ap_inlined;
  868.         ap_specialised;
  869.       }
  870.   | Lfunction { kind; params; return; body; attr; loc; } ->
  871.       Lfunction { kind; params; return; body = f body; attr; loc; }
  872.   | Llet (str, k, v, e1, e2) ->
  873.       Llet (str, k, v, f e1, f e2)
  874.   | Lmutlet (k, v, e1, e2) ->
  875.       Lmutlet (k, v, f e1, f e2)
  876.   | Lletrec (idel, e2) ->
  877.       Lletrec (List.map (fun (v, e) -> (v, f e)) idel, f e2)
  878.   | Lprim (p, el, loc) ->
  879.       Lprim (p, List.map f el, loc)
  880.   | Lswitch (e, sw, loc) ->
  881.       Lswitch (f e,
  882.                { sw_numconsts = sw.sw_numconsts;
  883.                  sw_consts = List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, f e)) sw.sw_consts;
  884.                  sw_numblocks = sw.sw_numblocks;
  885.                  sw_blocks = List.map (fun (n, e) -> (n, f e)) sw.sw_blocks;
  886.                  sw_failaction = Option.map f sw.sw_failaction;
  887.                },
  888.                loc)
  889.   | Lstringswitch (e, sw, default, loc) ->
  890.       Lstringswitch (
  891.         f e,
  892.         List.map (fun (s, e) -> (s, f e)) sw,
  893.         Option.map f default,
  894.         loc)
  895.   | Lstaticraise (i, args) ->
  896.       Lstaticraise (i, List.map f args)
  897.   | Lstaticcatch (body, id, handler) ->
  898.       Lstaticcatch (f body, id, f handler)
  899.   | Ltrywith (e1, v, e2) ->
  900.       Ltrywith (f e1, v, f e2)
  901.   | Lifthenelse (e1, e2, e3) ->
  902.       Lifthenelse (f e1, f e2, f e3)
  903.   | Lsequence (e1, e2) ->
  904.       Lsequence (f e1, f e2)
  905.   | Lwhile (e1, e2) ->
  906.       Lwhile (f e1, f e2)
  907.   | Lfor (v, e1, e2, dir, e3) ->
  908.       Lfor (v, f e1, f e2, dir, f e3)
  909.   | Lassign (v, e) ->
  910.       Lassign (v, f e)
  911.   | Lsend (k, m, o, el, loc) ->
  912.       Lsend (k, f m, f o, List.map f el, loc)
  913.   | Levent (l, ev) ->
  914.       Levent (f l, ev)
  915.   | Lifused (v, e) ->
  916.       Lifused (v, f e)

  918. ‌let map f =
  919.   let rec g lam = f (shallow_map g lam) in
  920.   g

  922. (* To let-bind expressions to variables *)

  924. ‌let bind_with_value_kind str (var, kind) exp body =
  925.   match exp with
  926.     Lvar var' when Ident.same var var' -> body
  927.   | _ -> Llet(str, kind, var, exp, body)

  929. ‌let bind str var exp body =
  930.   bind_with_value_kind str (var, Pgenval) exp body

  932. ‌let negate_integer_comparison = function
  933.   | Ceq -> Cne
  934.   | Cne -> Ceq
  935.   | Clt -> Cge
  936.   | Cle -> Cgt
  937.   | Cgt -> Cle
  938.   | Cge -> Clt

  940. ‌let swap_integer_comparison = function
  941.   | Ceq -> Ceq
  942.   | Cne -> Cne
  943.   | Clt -> Cgt
  944.   | Cle -> Cge
  945.   | Cgt -> Clt
  946.   | Cge -> Cle

  948. ‌let negate_float_comparison = function
  949.   | CFeq -> CFneq
  950.   | CFneq -> CFeq
  951.   | CFlt -> CFnlt
  952.   | CFnlt -> CFlt
  953.   | CFgt -> CFngt
  954.   | CFngt -> CFgt
  955.   | CFle -> CFnle
  956.   | CFnle -> CFle
  957.   | CFge -> CFnge
  958.   | CFnge -> CFge

  960. ‌let swap_float_comparison = function
  961.   | CFeq -> CFeq
  962.   | CFneq -> CFneq
  963.   | CFlt -> CFgt
  964.   | CFnlt -> CFngt
  965.   | CFle -> CFge
  966.   | CFnle -> CFnge
  967.   | CFgt -> CFlt
  968.   | CFngt -> CFnlt
  969.   | CFge -> CFle
  970.   | CFnge -> CFnle

  972. ‌let raise_kind = function
  973.   | Raise_regular -> "raise"
  974.   | Raise_reraise -> "reraise"
  975.   | Raise_notrace -> "raise_notrace"

  977. ‌let merge_inline_attributes attr1 attr2 =
  978.   match attr1, attr2 with
  979.   | Default_inline, _ -> Some attr2
  980.   | _, Default_inline -> Some attr1
  981.   | _, _ ->
  982.     if attr1 = attr2 then Some attr1
  983.     else None

  985. ‌let function_is_curried func =
  986.   match func.kind with
  987.   | Curried -> true
  988.   | Tupled -> false

  990. ‌let find_exact_application kind ~arity args =
  991.   match kind with
  992.   | Curried ->
  993.       if arity <> List.length args
  994.       then None
  995.       else Some args
  996.   | Tupled ->
  997.       begin match args with
  998.       | [Lprim(Pmakeblock _, tupled_args, _)] ->
  999.           if arity <> List.length tupled_args
  1000.           then None
  1001.           else Some tupled_args
  1002.       | [Lconst(Const_block (_, const_args))] ->
  1003.           if arity <> List.length const_args
  1004.           then None
  1005.           else Some (List.map (fun cst -> Lconst cst) const_args)
  1006.       | _ -> None
  1007.       end

  1009. let reset () =
  1010.   raise_count := 0

One Level Up Top Level
